meanings.definition: A tree of the genus Nyssa, especially N. sylvatica, having alternate, simple leaves and small, greenish flowers.
meanings.sent1: The tupelo stood tall in the forest, its leaves rustling in the breeze.
meanings.sent2: I learned about the tupelo tree in science class.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels played hide-and-seek around the tupelo, using its trunk as a base.
meanings.sent4: The tupelo tree's branches reached out like welcoming arms.
meanings.sent5: The tupelo tree's greenish flowers added a touch of color to the woods.

meanings.definition: The wood of this tree, used for making furniture and crates.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter crafted a beautiful table from tupelo wood.
meanings.sent2: The shipping company preferred using tupelo for sturdy crates.
meanings.sent3: The furniture store owner joked that the tupelo wood was as tough as nails.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of fresh tupelo wood filled the workshop.
meanings.sent5: The smooth texture of tupelo wood made it ideal for crafting furniture.

meanings.definition: A sweet honey made from the nectar of the tupelo tree.
meanings.sent1: I spread tupelo honey on my toast for breakfast.
meanings.sent2: The local market sold jars of delicious tupelo honey.
meanings.sent3: The bees buzzed happily after collecting nectar from the tupelo tree.
meanings.sent4: The tupelo honey was so sweet, it reminded me of summer days.
meanings.sent5: The golden tupelo honey glistened in the sunlight.
